html.div:
This dashboard provides visibility into the flow of data through the system. As documented here, data indexed by Splunk moves through several distinct phases of its life cycle. Administrators may wish to track these transitions more closely to understand which retention constraints are being applied to the data. Further, it can be useful to understand if the system is in a steady state, where the influx matches the data being archived out of Splunk, or whether that balance tips in another direction.
The size values given in the table below (in the columns identified as Current) are for the current day (values collected at midnight). The Delta columns reflect the change from the prior 24h period. A negative value represents a decline from the prior day, and can signal archival or state transition (hot to warm, warm to cold, etc).

table.title: Data Movement Per-Host
table.searchString: earliest=-1d@d `_fb_summary_recs_host("*")` | bucket _time span=1d | rename comment AS "This is just to get the deduped size of each bucket" | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by _time, id, state, host, index, path | eval marker=case(relative_time(now(), "@d") > _time, "yesterday", 1==1, "today") | stats sum(eval(if(state="hot" AND marker="today", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS hot_today sum(eval(if(state="hot" AND marker="yesterday", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS hot_yesterday sum(eval(if(state="warm" AND marker="today", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS warm_today sum(eval(if(state="warm" AND marker="yesterday", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS warm_yesterday sum(eval(if(state="cold" AND marker="today", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS cold_today sum(eval(if(state="cold" AND marker="yesterday", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS cold_yesterday by host | eval cold_delta=cold_today - cold_yesterday | eval warm_delta=warm_today - warm_yesterday | eval hot_delta=hot_today - hot_yesterday | table host, hot_today, hot_delta, warm_today, warm_delta, cold_today, cold_delta | foreach hot_*, warm_*, cold_* [ `_fb_mbytes_pretty(<<FIELD>>)` ] | rename host AS Indexer hot_today AS "Current Hot Usage" hot_delta AS "Hot Delta" warm_today AS "Current Warm Usage" warm_delta AS "Warm Delta" cold_today AS "Current Cold Usage" cold_delta AS "Cold Delta"
